Thanks Stefan.

Is there an api or manual for the Ant 1.6 alpah version
that would explain the spawn attribute and any other
new features?

- Billy -


On 04 Aug 2003 09:15:55 +0200, Stefan Bodewig wrote:





On Fri, 01 Aug 2003, billy bacon
<billy.bacon@...> wrote:

> My deploy.test target depends on starting tomcat and
> then makes an <antcall target> to my 'test' target
> which executes my tests. It seems to be hanging after
> tomcat is started successfully.

Ant doesn't start <exec> or <java> asynchronously. 
What you see is
Ant waiting for Tomcat to finish.

If you want to start Tomcat and run your tests at the
same time, you
should use Ant's <parallel>, something like

<parallel>
  <... start-tomcat ...>
  <sequential>
    <sleep ... long enough to be sure tomcat has been
started ...>
    <... run tests ...>
    <... kill Tomcat ...>
  </sequential>
</parallel>

I should note that Cactus provides specialized tasks
for this common
sequence and that the current CVS HEAD of Ant adds the
ability to
start processes and then continue with Ant (a new spawn
attribute on
<exec> and <java>).

Stefan
